tasks.title: Core Utilities - utils_core.js Implementation
tasks.description: Implement utils_core.js with shared utility functions for type detection, deep cloning, path manipulation, and format inference.
tasks.details:
Functions to implement:
- inferType(value): Returns 'string'|'number'|'integer'|'boolean'|'null'|'array'|'object'
- isObject(val), isArray(val), isString(val), isNumber(val), isBoolean(val), isNull(val)
- deepClone(obj): Safe deep copy
- getValueAtPath(obj, path): Get value using dot notation
- setValueAtPath(obj, path, value): Set value using dot notation
- detectFormat(str): Detect email, uri, date-time, uuid, ipv4, ipv6 patterns
- getAllPaths(obj): Get all leaf paths in an object
- mergeDeep(target, source): Deep merge objects
Export all to window.JSONToolsCore

tasks.title: JSON Schema Generator - schema_generator.js
tasks.description: Implement JSON Schema Generator that creates Draft 2020-12 compliant schemas from sample JSON data.
tasks.details:
Features:
- inferSchema(sample, options): Generate schema from single sample
- mergeSchemas(schemas[]): Merge multiple schemas, detect optional fields
- Infer types: string, integer, number, boolean, null, array, object
- Detect formats: email, uri, date-time, uuid, ipv4, hostname
- Handle nested objects recursively
- Handle arrays with item type inference (homogeneous/heterogeneous)
- Options: addTitles, addDescriptions, markRequired, uniqueItems for arrays
- Output includes $schema, $id, title, type, properties, required, items
- Handle edge cases: empty objects, null values, mixed arrays
Export to window.SchemaGenerator

tasks.title: JSON Shaper - json_shaper.js Implementation
tasks.description: Implement JSON Shaper that generates structure outlines showing types without values.
tasks.details:
Features:
- getStructure(json, options): Returns structure representation
- Modes:
  - 'verbose': Full JSON structure with type names as values
  - 'compact': Single-line { id, name, address { city, zip } }
  - 'compact-typed': { id:number, name:string, address { city:string } }
- Handle nested objects and arrays
- Array representation: [ { item:type, price:type } ]
- Options: showTypes, compactMode, maxDepth
- Return both string and object representations
- Support collapsible tree data structure for UI
Export to window.JSONShaper

tasks.title: JSON Linter - json_linter.js Implementation
tasks.description: Implement JSON Linter with validation, error reporting, and auto-repair capabilities.
tasks.details:
Features:
- lint(text): Returns { valid: boolean, errors: [], repaired?: string }
- Error types to detect:
  - Missing commas between properties
  - Trailing commas
  - Unquoted keys
  - Mismatched brackets/braces
  - Invalid escape sequences
  - Single quotes instead of double
- Error location: { line, column, message, severity }
- autoRepair(text): Attempt to fix common issues
- Repair strategies:
  - Add missing commas
  - Remove trailing commas
  - Quote unquoted keys
  - Fix bracket matching
  - Convert single to double quotes
- Integration with parseFlexibleJSON for Python syntax support
- Show before/after diff of repairs
Export to window.JSONLinter

tasks.title: JSON Flattener - json_flattener.js Implementation
tasks.description: Implement JSON Flattener and Unflattener with dot notation support.
tasks.details:
Features:
- flatten(obj, options): Convert nested object to flat key-value pairs
  - Dot notation: user.address.city
  - Array notation: tags[0], tags[1] or tags.0, tags.1
  - Options: delimiter (default '.'), arrayNotation ('bracket'|'dot'), maxDepth
- unflatten(obj, options): Restore nested structure from flat
  - Auto-detect array notation
  - Preserve original types
- Round-trip guarantee: unflatten(flatten(obj)) === obj
- Handle edge cases:
  - Empty arrays/objects
  - Null values
  - Keys with dots in names (escape handling)
  - Deep nesting (100+ levels)
  - Mixed array/object structures
Export to window.JSONFlattener

tasks.title: JSON to Table - json_to_table.js Implementation
tasks.description: Implement JSON to Table converter with Markdown and HTML output support.
tasks.details:
Features:
- toMarkdownTable(data, options): Generate markdown table
  - Flatten nested objects to dot notation columns
  - Array handling: comma-separated or indexed columns
  - Auto-align columns
  - Handle missing values gracefully
- toHTMLTable(data, options): Generate HTML table
  - Mode 1: Simple flat table
  - Mode 2: Expandable sections using <details>/<summary>
  - Mode 3: Rowspan/colspan for nested structures
  - Inline styles for standalone use
  - Nested arrays become sub-tables
- Options:
  - flatten: true/false
  - arrayMode: 'index'|'named'|'expand'
  - expandNested: true/false
  - includeEmpty: true/false
  - format: 'markdown'|'html'
- Auto-detect input structure (array vs single object)
Export to window.JSONToTable

tasks.title: JSON Fuzzer - json_fuzzer.js Implementation
tasks.description: Implement JSON Fuzzer/Randomizer that generates random valid JSON from schemas or samples.
tasks.details:
Features:
- generateFromSchema(schema, options): Create random data matching schema
  - Type-specific generation: string, number, integer, boolean, null
  - Format-aware: email, uri, date-time, uuid, ipv4
  - Respect constraints: minLength, maxLength, minimum, maximum, enum
  - Array generation with minItems, maxItems
  - Nested object generation
- generateFromSample(sample, options): Infer structure and generate similar
  - Preserve structure, randomize values
  - Type-appropriate random values
- Options:
  - mode: 'normal'|'edge'|'stress'
  - Edge mode: empty strings, max values, special chars, unicode
  - Stress mode: very long strings, deep nesting, large arrays
  - seed: for reproducible randomness
- Random data generators:
  - Names, emails, addresses (realistic)
  - Numbers within ranges
  - Dates within ranges
  - UUIDs, IPs, URLs
Export to window.JSONFuzzer

tasks.title: Performance Optimization - Large File Handling
tasks.description: Performance optimization review and implementation for large JSON handling.
tasks.details:
Optimizations:
- Debounced real-time updates (300ms for input, 500ms for heavy operations)
- Web Worker for heavy operations (schema gen, flattening large objects)
- Virtual scrolling for large output lists
- Streaming JSON parsing option for 10MB+ files
- Memory-efficient flattening (avoid full object copies)
- Lazy rendering for tree views
- Cancel long-running operations
- Progress indicators for slow operations
- Performance benchmarks:
  - 10KB JSON: < 50ms
  - 100KB JSON: < 200ms
  - 1MB JSON: < 1s
  - 10MB JSON: < 5s with streaming
Add performance test cases to test suite
